hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with summer squash and sausage stew
that's right this is another installment

am i supposed to do with all these
summer squash and this time we're

potatoey sausage stew in which to hide
the aforementioned squash in oh man
did it work beautifully so check this
out this was absolutely delicious so I
have a couple andouille sausage those
are lightly smoked pork sausage little

squash some yellow zucchini and what

step one I'm gonna slice up the sausage
so I cut those in half and I thought I
was gonna do four slices at once but
after a couple cuts I realized I'm not
cutting them that even so I just went to
doing two instead which was much easier
so the moral of this story don't be a
hero okay so we're gonna slice up our

off I'm gonna cut this in half then I'll
use a little angle to cut at the bottom
to remove that although I think that's
optional
I'm pretty sure that's not poisonous so
up to you and then we're gonna cut each
half in half and then across in three
sections just like that and you know the
drill here once you've picked the size
you got to stick with it so try to get
as evenly sized pieces as possible
that's only because we want it to cook
at the same rate all right and even
though our zucchini is a different shape
than the round squash we're still gonna
cut off the ends cut it in half all
right cut that down the middle and use
that first green squash we cut as a
guide to get similarly sized pieces so
take your time and cut up your squash as
uniformly as possible and then besides
our sausage and squash we're also gonna
add some potatoes
so I have some Yukon Gold potatoes that
I've peeled and quartered and if you're
going low-carb those are optional but
this do is ten to fifteen times better
with the potatoes and that's not my
opinion that is a fact so I'm gonna prep
those and just leave them in water till
needed and at that point we're gonna go
over to the stove where I have a stew

olive oil I'm gonna throw in my end ooey
sausage and we're gonna saute those for
about three or four minutes until they
begin to caramelize and don't be
surprised if it smells really good at
this point all right once the edges
start to brown we're gonna go ahead and
dump in a diced onion you can probably
lower your heat down to medium at this
point
and we're just gonna sweat those onions
with that sausage for about five minutes
until they soften and turn translucent
they should look something like that
and at that point we're gonna throw in a
whole bunch of garlic and we're only
gonna cook the garlic for about a minute
we don't want it to brown we're just
gonna give it a quick sizzle and then I
like to dump in a little bit of green
pepper now you can use green bell pepper
but I'm actually using a jalapeno I had
in the fridge you know I don't mind this
spicy and jalapeno is not even that
spicy anyway but I think he do want a
little bit of green pepper that a little
bit of bitterness really brings out the
sweetness in the squash and the tomato
so I'm gonna stir that in next up we're
gonna add some tomato product I'm using
crushed San Marzano tomatoes along with
some chicken broth and or stock so we'll
stir that in at this point you can raise
your heat too high because we're gonna
bring this up to a simmer and while
we're waiting for that to happen go
ahead and dump in your drain potatoes
and of course our squash and don't worry
if it doesn't look like there's enough
liquid as soon as it starts to cook
those squash are gonna release a lot of

having said that with something like
this you're always gonna adjust your
liquid level add a little more stock if
you need to so stir that in and while
we're waiting for that to come up to
temperature we're gonna go ahead and
season it with a good dose of salt you
know my thoughts on underseasoned

gonna add some salt now of course we're
gonna taste and adjust later because we
always do we'll also give it a little

black pepper and other than some fresh
parsley at the end that's pretty much it

maintain a steady simmer all right
something like that and all we're gonna
do is simply simmer this uncovered until

yes our pieces of potato are larger than

those potatoes are gonna take about 3035

to that perfect points I'm gonna go
